title: 112_hr1742
content: The Act titled the "Janey Ensminger Act" establishes presumptions of service connection for illnesses related to contaminants in the water supply at Marine Corps Base Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. The "Janey Ensminger Act" establishes presumptions of service connection for illnesses associated with contaminants in the water supply at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, under section 1119 of title 38, United States Code. This includes diagnosed or undiagnosed illnesses determined by the Secretary in consultation with the Agency for Toxic Substances and Disease Registry. The regulations under this section establish a presumption of service connection for veterans exposed to volatile organic compounds at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. Illnesses must manifest within a specified period in veterans who served at Camp Lejeune and were exposed to these compounds during active duty. The regulations establish a presumption of service connection for veterans exposed to volatile organic compounds at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. If a positive association is found between exposure to these compounds and a disease, the Secretary will provide regulations for a presumption of service connection. The regulations establish a presumption of service connection for veterans exposed to volatile organic compounds at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. The Secretary will consider all medical and scientific information in making determinations, including statistically significant results, replication capability, and peer review. A positive association between a disease and exposure to volatile organic compounds will be considered if the credible evidence outweighs the evidence against it. When a disease is removed from regulations, the Secretary will provide regulations for a presumption of service connection. The regulations under this section ensure that veterans and survivors continue to receive compensation and benefits for diseases linked to exposure to volatile organic compounds at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. "Presumptions of service connection for illnesses associated with contaminants in the water supply at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina. Hospital care, medical services, and nursing home care for veterans stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina, while the water was contaminated." Family members of veterans stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina during the period of water contamination are eligible for hospital care, medical services, and nursing home care for covered conditions associated with exposure to contaminants in the water. Veterans' family members at Camp Lejeune during water contamination period are eligible for medical care for covered conditions. Health care coverage for family members of veterans stationed at Camp Lejeune, North Carolina during the contaminated water period.
